entry.title: 1. Peters Pub - 6pm
entry.description: "An institution - in the best sense of the word. The platform this pub is built on is the barmen. We're talking real Barmen. Barmen from a time that the Tiger forgot. People who remember you, even if you haven't been in for a year. People for who the smallest nod from your seat triggers a round re-order, delivered to the table. People who are both professional, and friendly." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

locations.entry: 2. Grogans - 6.30pm 53.34211 -6.262786, "Let me begin by saying I've drank in Grogans since moving to Dublin a few years back. The company and pints are always decent and I enjoy the fact that they allow art on the walls and sometimes you can smoke in the toilets." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 3. Dakota - 7pm
entry.description: "The staff are relatively good, and they generally have enough staff on that you're not waiting long for a drink. Their doormen have always been very polite to me as well which is a plus (not that I look rough or owt, but sometimes theyre just bad-tempered" - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 4. O’Neill’s - 7.30pm
entry.description: "This O'Neil Pub is indeed a wonderful Irish pub with great Irish food." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 5. O'Donoghues, Suffolk Street - 8pm
entry.description: "Strolling Grafton Street and wanted some lunch- stopped in and found a beautiful cozy pub. Got seats in back past the bar and enjoyed a very good casual lunch and a couple drinks. Decent menu but maybe a little pricey because of the location. We liked the other O'Donoghue's a bit better but still a worthy stop." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 6. Porterhouse, central - 8.30pm
entry.description: "with plenty of knowledge and the mircobrewed beers here are fantastic. I love the Oyster Stout and the Poterhouse Red" - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 7. Bailey - 9pm
entry.description: "They have heaters outside and blankets to keep warm on the cold..." Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 8. The Duke - 9.30pm
entry.description: "The Dublin Literary Pub Crawl starts at the Duke, in the upstairs..." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 9. Café en Seine - 10pm
entry.description: "Café en Seine always reminds me of The Moulin Rouge for some reason." Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 10. 37 Dawson Stret - 10.30pm
entry.description: "This is a cozy location and setting for a drink with friends. The first floor is long and narrow with a whiskey bar in the back. The drinks are strong and a bit pricey. " - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 11. The Dawson Lounge - 11pm
entry.description: "Great Guiness and worth a visit if you aren't closterphobic." - Courtesy of Yelp.ie

entry.title: 12. Kehoes - 11.30pm
entry.description: "Old school bar. Dark carpets, dark wood. Love the decor. Good service & good beer. The ladies room is a gorgeous lounge. Highly recommend this bar" - Courtesy of Yelp.ie
